instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in update loop
threads.message:
Hello Community,

I have a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A on my desk. After ultrasonic it always boots into an update OS. The updates ends with an error saying "A critical software update is required for your mac, but an error was encountered while installing this update."
[LIST]
[*]OS was already reinstalled without fixing the problem.
[*]Some forum say it is an WatchOS update for the touchbar. New touchbar did not fix the problem.
[/LIST] Does anybody know this issue? Any ideas where to look?

Thanks for you help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in update loop
threads.message:
Can you boot USB OSX?
Also try disconnecting Lifeboat connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in update loop
threads.message: Booting USB OSX with or without connected lifeboat connector both ends in the same error :(
